text:
Andanar loses cool over questions about $1k bribe claim ABS-CBN News Posted at Feb 21 2017 01:49 PM | Updated as of Feb 21 2017 02:18 PM 
Share Facebook 
Presidential Communications Secretary Martin Andanar on Tuesday lost his cool with a Palace reporter after being questioned about his claim of alleged $1,000 bribes offered to Senate reporters to cover the press conference of retired cop Arturo Lascañas. 
During the presser, Andanar refused to apologize for his claim because he based his information on a "confidential intelligence report." He also said he validated the report but he did not ask why the bribes were at $1,000. 
"Hindi ko po tinanong yun. Siguro, I don't know kung bakit dolyar. Hindi ko sinabi na reporter na 1,000 dollars ang umiikot. That's 50,000 pesos. Naliliitan ka ba sa 50,000," he asked. 
He also told a reporter not to pit him against Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana and National Security Adviser Hermogenes Esperon Jr. after they already said there was no plot to unseat President Rodrigo Duterte. 
"Siguro may mga intelligence reports na hindi nakakarating sa lahat. There are classified reports," he said. 
He then asked the reporter: "Are you fair on everything that you write?" 
"Yes," said the reporter. 
"How about your post on social media?" 
"That's my personal." 
"Exactly. As a reporter, you are an ambassador of your newspaper," he added, shaking his head.
